title: English (1837) Tyndales New Testament (1526 version)
description: English (1837) Tyndale's New Testament (1526 version): Tyndale's New Testament, originally translated in 1526, was the first English translation of the New Testament to be printed. The 1837 edition marks the first American publication of this historic translation, featuring an introduction by J.A. Dabney. This edition is significant as it represents a key moment in the dissemination of the Bible in English, particularly in America. It's a part of the wider historical context of making religious texts more accessible to the general public, a movement in which William Tyndale was a pivotal figure. His 1526 translation laid the foundation for subsequent English translations of the Bible, including the King James Version.
